head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Not Guilty Pleas In Killing

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Britain: Not Guilty Pleas In Killing

abstract.p: Four teenage boys plead not guilty in killing of 10-year-old boy fatally stabbed in Nov 2000 as he returned home to rough housing project in southeast London; slain boy, Damilola Taylor, was Nigerian immigrant who had been in London for just four months (S)

block.p: Four teenage boys pleaded not guilty in the killing of a 10-year-old boy who was fatally stabbed in November 2000 as he returned home to a rough housing project in southeast London from an after-school computer class. The slain boy, Damilola Taylor, a Nigerian immigrant who had been in London for just four months, bled to death after being stabbed in the leg in a deserted stairwell five minutes from his home. The trial of the three 16-year-olds and one 14-year-old is expected to last up to three months.

Four teenage boys pleaded not guilty in the killing of a 10-year-old boy who was fatally stabbed in November 2000 as he returned home to a rough housing project in southeast London from an after-school computer class. The slain boy, Damilola Taylor, a Nigerian immigrant who had been in London for just four months, bled to death after being stabbed in the leg in a deserted stairwell five minutes from his home. The trial of the three 16-year-olds and one 14-year-old is expected to last up to three months.
